description:
The module examines issues of gender and sexuality in historical and contemporary Southeast Asia, and considers how key texts and theories in the field of gender and
sexuality studies might be applied in the Southeast Asian context. It shows that categories of gender and sexuality have long been implicated in the formation of such
dichotomous cultural paradigms as ‘East’ and ‘West,’ modern and traditional, and religious and secular that continues to serve as constitutive sources of power,
identity, and knowledge.
title: Gender and Sexuality in Southeast Asia
